name: Air Fryer Chicken Kiev Balls
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: These chicken Kiev balls are crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, stuffed with seasoned butter, and sure to be a hit on game day or any day of the year. Bonus is that this recipe uses ground chicken, so no pounding is required!
directions: Mix butter, parsley, and garlic together in a bowl until evenly combined
Divide mixture into 12 equal parts on a baking sheet
Make a deep thumbprint in the center of each ball
Place a piece of frozen herbed butter in the indention and wrap meat around the butter until it is fully encased
Place beaten eggs in a bowl
Combine panko, paprika, salt, and pepper in a separate bowl
Dip 1 ground chicken ball first in the beaten eggs, then in the seasoned bread crumbs
Dip the ball back into the egg and in the seasoned bread crumbs once more
Place on a baking sheet and freeze for 10 minutes
Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Place 1/2 of the balls in the air fryer basked and spray with nonstick cooking spray
Flip balls over with tongs and spray again with nonstick cooking spray
